name: The "J" Bible Quiz | Bible Alphabetics | 10 Questions

questions.text: Which of these is a son of Esau?
questions.explanation:
Jaalam.

	His brothers were Eliphaz, Reuel, Jeush and Korah. Their mother was Aholibamah.

questions.text: Which city did Moses spy on in Numbers 21:32 of the King James Version?
questions.explanation:
Jazer.

	The same verse said he drove out the Amorites that were there. Jazer was a city east of the Jordan River and Gilead.

questions.text: Which river is mentioned in Deuteronomy 2:37 of the King James Version?
questions.explanation:
Jabbok.

	This was the border of the Amorites. Today it is known as the Zarqa River. It flows midway between the Sea of Galilee and the Dead Sea. It is in Eastern Palestine.

questions.text: Whose son slew the brother of Goliath?
questions.explanation:
Jaarearejim.

	His son's name was Elhanan. 2 Samuel 21:19 (KJV) says there was a famine in Gob with the Philistines.

Jecoliah.

	Jecoliah was from Jerusalem according to 2 Chronicles 26:3 (KJV). Her name means "is powerful".

Jehoshaphat.

	You can read about Jehoshaphat in 1 Kings 22. Both he and the king of Israel (Jehoshaphat was king of Judah) did not like to hear from the prophet Micaiah because he did not tell them what they wanted to hear. This is still true today for many people; they don't like to get advice from certain people because the person tells them what they need to hear not what they want to hear.

questions.text: In Luke 8:23 (KJV), Jesus had fallen asleep when the storm on the sea came. What does the verse say they were in?
questions.explanation:
jeopardy.

	If you continue reading chapter 8, you will find out that they woke Jesus up. Jesus calmed the storm and told his disciples they had little faith.

questions.text: Who blew a trumpet in 2 Samuel 2:28 (KJV)?
questions.explanation:
Joab.

	When he did the people stood still and stopped attacking Israel. Joab's name means "paternity" or "voluntarily".

questions.text: Saul cast lots between himself and whom?
questions.explanation:
Jonathan.

	They took Jonathan away because he ate some honey. Jonathan said in 1 Samuel 14:43 (KJV) " I did but taste a little honey with the end of the rod that was in mine hand, and, lo, I must die." However, the people of Israel rescued Jonathan in 14:45 so he did not die.

questions.text: In which river was Jesus baptized?
questions.explanation:
Jordan.

	Jesus was baptized by his cousin John the Baptist. According to Matthew 3:17 KJV), when Jesus was baptized a voice from Heaven said, "This is my beloved Son, in whom I am well pleased."
